messages.message: For anyone familiar with our monaco editors - any ideas why suggestions would not be popping up even though I pass `constants` in to the component? It works in the custom function editors in Build, but I can't get it to work for downstream integration custom functions :thinking_face: Maybe because it's in a modal and something about focus? Context menus do work though...
Or maybe @Liam Callanan you have some ideas with how focus on modals works?
how are you using monaco right now? is it using `MonacoEditor` directly or using `CustomCodeLanguageEditor`?
`CustomCodeLanguageEditor`, it's almost exactly the same as how FunctionBodyEditor is using it
It's in the `ModalContentUdf` component. Right now it's passing through an empt array for `constants`, but now I'm passing through actual values and still seeing no suggestions
I’m able to see suggestions in a modal so I don’t think its modal related :thinking_face:
I get the syntax highlighting so I know the language model is initiating
Yep, I logged in the console that my constants were correct inside that useEffect
interesting, I wonder if there’s a difference instance of `CustomCodeLanguage` used in a different editor thats conflicting?? Other than that I don’t have any ideas :face_with_diagonal_mouth:
Hmm that's a good point! Let me good look for other places it might be instantiated
Figured it out!! It was because it was in an Accordion component :open_mouth: @Liam Callanan would love to get your input on this in the morning!
